first_story_block: You live in the town of CYS and today’s the day of the tournament! You are very excited to play all the powerful players of CYS, and to beat the four most powerful players of “Commander” today. The mayor of the town, JJ, had announced that whoever can beat the most powerful of the four commanders will win a great prize today. But, before that, do you know the rules to “Commander”?

action_results.result: That’s great! But I’ve made some changes to JJ’s rules. Here’s the rule book for you to go through, and find out what the changes are.The changes will be outlined in red, and bolded at the bottom of the rulebook
Now that you’ve gotten your rule book, make sure to read through it carefully before challenging any players!

Today’s the day of the tournament! The mayor of CYS town had everyone gather at the stadium for the event! Everyone is free to challenge everyone else. When you’ve defeated five players, you will be free to challenge the four greatest commanders of CYS.


If you beat the strongest of them four, you will earn a great prize from JJ himself!


Looking around you, you see a bunch of people lounging around the stadium. To your right, there is a loud kid with frizzy white hair, and a short kid with sharp eyes and mustache, pointing at and laughing at another slightly chubby kid that’s being defeated by one of the great four. Tears roll down the chubby kid’s cheeks as he is slowly, but surely annihilate by his opponent.  


On the shirt of those people, you can see stickers with their names plastered onto their shirts. Everyone has their names plastered to their shirts, so that they’re easily identifiable. You look away, slightly anxious now. You hope you get a chance to challenge one of the great four.


Looking around some more, you decide on who you want to challenge for the time being. Remembering that you need to defeat 5 people before even getting to challenge one of the great four, you narrow your eyes in determination before looking for an easy target to play against.


Total rounds won: 0


Total rounds lost: 0


Total rounds draw: 0

You slowly, and confidently walk toward this person with the sticker ‘nmelssx’ plastered on a white shirt, and put on a silly grin onto your face. 


"Hey, there." You greet nmelssx in a friendly tone. "What do you say to a match?"



Nmelssx glance up at you, before acquiescing. 'Alright.'
Well. It's time to set the battlefield.

There are 1 land lane and 1 sea lane in this match.
     

 

Your Command Post: (Health 50) (Gold: 100)       


Land Lane 1: Total Attack: 0 Total Defense: 0 








Sea Lane 1: Total Attack: 0 Total Defense: 0






Opponent's Command Post: (Health 50) (Gold: 100)


Land Lane 1:  Total Attack: 0 Total Defense: 0








Sea Lane 1: Total Attack: 0 Total Defense: 0

You slowly, and confidently walk toward this person with the sticker ‘Quiller’ plastered on a white shirt, and put on a silly grin onto your face. 


"Hey, there." You greet Quiller in a friendly tone. "What do you say to a match?"



The Quiller glances up from a painting before nodding. 'Of course.'

You slowly, and confidently walk toward this person with the sticker ‘James’ plastered on a white shirt, and put on a silly grin onto your face. 


"Hey, there." You greet James in a friendly tone. "What do you say to a match?"



'I am sorry, but your loss is inevitable if you dare to challenge me.' Is James reply.

You slowly, and confidently walk toward this person with the sticker ‘Taco’ plastered on a white shirt, and put on a silly grin onto your face. 


"Hey, there." You greet Taco in a friendly tone. "What do you say to a match?"



'All right. To a fair game!' Taco raises a hand in a cheers gesture.

You slowly, and confidently walk toward this person with the sticker ‘Killa’ plastered on a white shirt, and put on a silly grin onto your face. 


"Hey, there." You greet Killa in a friendly tone. "What do you say to a match?"



'I estimate that your chance of winning is about at...0.03 percent.' Killa says. 'But, nevertheless, I will play you.'

The rules to playing “Commander” is pretty simple, actually. Once you get the grasp of it, you will breeze through your opponents like a  hot knife through butter. XD


Here’s the rulebook. Make sure to read it carefully, even if you’ve played before, because I’ve made some interesting changes to JJ’s rules. The changes will be outlined in red, and bolded at the bottom of the rulebook.
